intro: Anisophyllea dinghoui, commonly known as the Dinghou anisophyllea, is a species of flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves with alternating leaflets. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in mountainous regions. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
